details.flavorText: Dero stalkers are those charged with exploring the surface world by night and seeking out new victims to abduct.

description.value:
You cloud the target's mind and daze it with a mental jolt. The jolt deals mental damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier; the target must attempt a basic Will save. If the target critically fails the save, it is also @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} 1.

Heightened The damage increases by 1d6.
description.label: Description

description.value:
You create an auditory illusion of simple sounds that has a maximum volume equal to four normal humans shouting. The sounds emanate from a square you designate within range. You can’t create intelligible words or other intricate sounds (such as music).

Heightened The range increases to 60 feet.

Heightened The range increases to 120 feet.
description.label: Description

description.value: A dero stalker takes [[/r 4 # damage]] damage for every hour they’re exposed to sunlight.

Requirements The dero stalker is not encumbered. Trigger A creature targets the dero with an attack and the dero can see the attacker. Effect The dero dodges out of the way, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to AC against the triggering attack.

A dero stalker deals [[/r 1d6 # extra precision damage]] extra precision damage to @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} creatures.
When the monster Strikes a creature that has the @Compendium[pf2e.conditionspf2e.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Flat-Footed} condition with an agile or finesse melee weapon, an agile or finesse unarmed attack, or a ranged weapon attack, it also deals the listed precision damage. For a ranged attack with a thrown weapon, that weapon must also be an agile or finesse weapon.

Saving Throw DC 14 Fortitude; Maximum Duration 6 rounds; Stage 1 [[/r 1d6 # poison damage]] poison damage (1 round); Stage 2 [[/r 1d8 # poison damage]] poison damage and flat-footed (1 round); Stage 3 [[/r 1d12 # poison damage]] poison damage, clumsy 1, and flat-footed (1 round).
